sik.client.admin.services
Class RMIClient

java.lang.Object
  sik.client.admin.services.RMIClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote
public class RMIClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

Class to act as an RMI Client which uses an RMI Server Interface to connect to a remote RMI server implementation and gain the ability to call remote methods as the the using data will be stored on a remote server

Author:
Jamie Brindle (06352322) - Manchester Metropolitan University
See Also:

loadStoreFromRMI

public sik.common.Store loadStoreFromRMI(boolean silent)
                                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                         java.net.ConnectException
Invokes the RMIServer to send a student record store (it 'gets' a remote student record store)

Parameters:
silent - Defines which RMIServer method to invoke. Silent or not. Silent prevents the recording of information which is sometimes preferred depending on the operation
Returns:
Store The student records store
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - when any remote connectivity problems occur
java.net.ConnectException

saveStoreToRMI

public void saveStoreToRMI(sik.common.Store store)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                           java.net.ConnectException
Saves a student records store to the already connected RMI server

Parameters:
store - The student records store to save to remote location
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - when any remote connectivity problems occur
java.net.ConnectException
